meanings.definition: To sow seeds again in an area.
meanings.sent1: She reseeds her garden every spring to ensure beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The farmer reseeds the field after each harvest to maintain fertile soil.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to reseeds the bird feeder with acorns instead of seeds.
meanings.sent4: His kindness reseeds hope in the hearts of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The act of reseeding the lawn transforms it into a lush green carpet.

meanings.definition: To plant seeds for future growth.
meanings.sent1: The children reseeds the pumpkin seeds in the garden to watch them grow.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often reseeds crops to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to reseeds an endless supply of colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter reseeds joy in the hearts of all who hear it.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement reseeds confidence in her students.
